column4: hey, I have a problem with two computers connected via ethernet... I'd like to access the webserver on a port 8000 on one computer from the other one
ah sorry forgot to say that won't work
as I said it doesn't work
the server is running on the same port. On the same computer I can access the site
how can I open the 8000 for other computer to reach it?
I am still having trouble to access a webserver over a local network
I now how to address it, the other computer just refuses the connection
now, it's a django development server
and there are usually no restrictions. Other projects don't work either
that might be, and that's why I am asking how to find out
I don't remember setting up a firewall
no, there is just the refused connection
is anything showing in the apache logs when you try to connect?
